newsitem.title: USA: Accugraph names Paul Damp as CEO.
newsitem.headline: Accugraph names Paul Damp as CEO.

text.p: Accugraph Corp's said its board of directors had appointed Paul Damp as its chairman and chief executive officer.
The company, a supplier of network information software and services, said Damp will replace Hector Holguin, who was chairman since 1989.
Damp, whose promotion comes into effect immediately, will also replace Dennis McGinn as president and chief executive officer, it said.
Holguin will stay on the board but will not be involved in the company's daily operations, while McGinn will become a consultant for the company for six months, it added.
Damp, an Accugraph board member since 1991, was chairman and chief execuive officer of Kestrel Capital Corp, a Toronto investment holding and management company.
